intro: Andromeda lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wintergreen, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are lanceolate, hence the species name, and its fragrant flowers bloom in early spring. The plant is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
